docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 29 -- The Administration has chosen to react with Job-like patience to the latest act of defiance by the regime of Premier Fidel Castro in Cuba -- the keeping of a turbo-prop airliner that was capture this week in the Florida skies.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 29 -- The Administration has chosen to react with Job-like patience to the latest act of defiance by the regime of Premier Fidel Castro in Cuba -- the keeping of a turbo-prop airliner that was capture this week in the Florida skies.
docs.abstract: US policy of restraint and patience in face of Castro's provocations analyzed; Latin-Amer trend against Castro linked; cartoon

headline.main: U.S. ON CASTRO: PATIENCE IS KEY; U.S. Concentrates on Building Up Goodwill in Other Latin Areas

byline.original: By TAD SZULC Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The halting of the downward trend and sharp upward swing of the British pound sterling featured the movements in the foreign exchange market last week. This recovery followed the announcement by Mr. Selwyn Lloyd, Chancellor of the Exchequer, on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The halting of the downward trend and sharp upward swing of the British pound sterling featured the movements in the foreign exchange market last week. This recovery followed the announcement by Mr. Selwyn Lloyd, Chancellor of the Exchequer, on Tuesday, of measures to reduce home consumption and Government spending and to advance exports and strengthen the pound. The bank rate was raised to 7 per cent. The Canadian dollar was steady on light dealings.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended July 28, 1961

docs.snippet: MADRID, Aug. 2 (UPI) -- The former Argentine dictator, Juan D. Peron, has sent a letter to President Kennedy accusing the United States of responsibility for Latin America's political and economic troubles, reliable sources reported tonight.
docs.lead_paragraph: MADRID, Aug. 2 (UPI) -- The former Argentine dictator, Juan D. Peron, has sent a letter to President Kennedy accusing the United States of responsibility for Latin America's political and economic troubles, reliable sources reported tonight.

headline.main: PERON CHARGE CITED; He Is Said to Accuse U.S. in Latin America's Troubles
